API Reference

Variational Quantum Circuit

Allows you to build and train variational quantum circuits with customizable ansätze. This module provides a flexible framework for creating quantum circuits that can be used for various quantum machine learning tasks.

class qmlearn.vqc.VariationalQuantumCircuit

Bases: object

generator(features, params, n_qubits, device, ansatz=None)
predict(features, n_qubits=None, device=None, diff_method='backprop')
train(features, labels, params=None, batch_size=32, epochs=1, n_qubits=None, device=None, ansatz=None, optimizer=<pennylane.optimize.adam.AdamOptimizer object>)

Quantum Feature Map

Allows you to transform classical data into a quantum data using a quantum feature map. The data can be used with classical models as part of a hybrid quantum model.

class qmlearn.qfm.QuantumFeatureMap

Bases: object

default_feature_map(qubits)
transform(data=None, feature_map=None, qubits=None, device=None)

Transforms classical data using a quantum feature map in Pennylane

Hybrid Classification

Allows you to swiftly train and use hybrid quantum-classical models for classification tasks.

class qmlearn.classification.HybridClassification

Bases: object

predict(features)
train(features, labels, model=None, random_state=42)

Hybrid Clustering

Allows you to swiftly train and use hybrid quantum-classical models for clustering tasks.

class qmlearn.clustering.HybridClustering

Bases: object

predict(data, n_clusters=0, model=None, random_state=42)

Hybrid Regression

Allows you to swiftly train hybrid quantum-classical models for regression tasks.

class qmlearn.regression.HybridRegression

Bases: object

predict(features)
train(features, labels, model=None, random_state=42)
